conclusion: In a velocity-time graph, the x-axis is time (t) and the y-axis is velocity (v). The slope of the graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant because acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
If the slope is positive, acceleration is positive; if it's negative, acceleration is negative.
